rtega_mnemonic:
嘲嘲RSridicule, deride, scorn, jeer at
  • a mouth 口 can ridicule anything even a powerful dynasty 朝
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 朝 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
嘲笑 [ cháo xiào ]: to jeer at; to deride; to ridicule; mockery; derision
嘲弄 [ cháo nòng ]: to tease; to poke fun at; to make fun of
嘲讽 [ cháo fěng ]: to sneer at; to ridicule; to taunt
自嘲 [ zì cháo ]: to mock oneself; to laugh at oneself
解嘲 [ jiě cháo ]: to try to cover up in an embarrassing situation; to justify oneself; to find excuses
嘲哳 [ zhāo zhā ]: (onom.) twitter; twittering sound

heisig_chinese_memo: Mouths of common people love to ridicule their dynasty rulers.
heisig_constituent: derision, mouth, morning , mist, ten, needle, early, sun, day, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, ten2, needle2
heisig_story: The bad feeling created by words spoken in derision often leaves a bad taste in the mouth of the one who speaks them, kind of like the foul aftertaste that follows a night before of too much of the wrong stuff - or what we call morning mouth.
myStory: насмехаться с внешнего вида - луна, посыпать цветы иглами
koohiiStory1: When I wake up, I am always late, so I hurry to work. With a bad case of perpetual morning breath, I am the subject of derision at my office whenever I open my mouth.
koohiiStory2: If morning breath emanates from your mouth, you are subject to derision!

Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the morning (朝) the mouth (口) makes fun of you
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mouths of common people love to ridicule their dynasty rulers.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " mouth " to " chao " sound. The original meaning is ridicule and ridicule. "Said Wen": "Mocking, mocking. From the mouth to the voice." Such as "Wen Xuan. Xie Lingyun "The Poems of Ye Zhong Ji, the prince Wei. "Ying Yan Poetry": "Smiles and pays answers, ridicules without embarrassment." Tang Dynasty Han Yu "Ji Lu Tong": "In previous years, I used pens to laugh at the same differences, but the strange remarks shocked the public."

" Mocking " also means chanting. For example, in Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi's "Liu Ti Jun Zhai": "Ying Shan Ge, water and mocking Fengyue, it is three years when the official is full." "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 30: "Do your best to mock the wind and the moon in this room, poem The wine is very romantic, the two of me would never dare to come and ask."

" Mocking " also means the singing of birds. "Qin Jing": "Lin Niao Chao Chao, the water bird night."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " mouth " to the sound of " Chao ". The original meaning is ridicule and ridicule.
humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「朝」聲。本義是譏諷、嘲笑。《說文》：「嘲，謔也。从口，朝聲。」 如《文選．謝靈運〈擬魏太子鄴中集詩．應瑒詩〉》：「調笑輒酬答，嘲謔無慚沮。」唐代韓愈〈寄盧仝〉：「往年弄筆嘲同異，怪辭驚眾謗不已。」

　　「嘲」也表示吟詠。如唐代白居易〈留題郡齋〉：「吟山歌水嘲風月，便是三年官滿時。」《兒女英雄傳》第30回：「儘著你在這屋裏嘲風弄月，詩酒風流，我兩個絕不敢來過問。」

　　「嘲」還表示鳥鳴。《禽經》：「林鳥朝嘲，水鳥夜㖡。」
humanum_short_description: 從「口」，「朝」聲。本義是譏諷、嘲笑。

從「 口 」，「 朝 」聲。本義是譏諷、嘲笑。《說文》：「嘲，謔也。从口，朝聲。」 如《文選．謝靈運〈擬魏太子鄴中集詩．應瑒詩〉》：「調笑輒酬答，嘲謔無慚沮。」唐代韓愈〈寄盧仝〉：「往年弄筆嘲同異，怪辭驚眾謗不已。」 「 嘲 」也表示吟詠。如唐代白居易〈留題郡齋〉：「吟山歌水嘲風月，便是三年官滿時。」《兒女英雄傳》第30回：「儘著你在這屋裏嘲風弄月，詩酒風流，我兩個絕不敢來過問。」 「 嘲 」還表示鳥鳴。《禽經》：「林鳥朝嘲，水鳥夜㖡。」
From " mouth" to " chao" sound. The original meaning is ridicule and ridicule. "Said Wen": "Mocking, mocking. From the mouth to the voice." Such as "Wen Xuan. Xie Lingyun "The Poems of Ye Zhong Ji, the prince Wei. "Ying Yan Poetry": "Smiles and pays answers, ridicules without embarrassment." Tang Dynasty Han Yu "Ji Lu Tong": "In previous years, I used pens to laugh at the same differences, but the strange remarks shocked the public." " Mocking" also means chanting. For example, in Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi's "Liu Ti Jun Zhai": "Ying Shan Ge, water and mocking Fengyue, it is three years when the official is full." "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 30: "Do your best to mock the wind and the moon in this room, poem The wine is very romantic, the two of me would never dare to come and ask." " Mocking" also means the singing of birds. "Qin Jing": "Lin Niao Chao Chao, the water bird night."

嘲字的基本解释

嘲
cháo
讥笑，拿人取笑：嘲笑。嘲弄。嘲骂。嘲诮。嘲谑。冷嘲热讽。

嘲
zhāo
〔嘲哳（zh?）〕同“啁哳”。

嘲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cháo］
［《廣韻》陟交切，平肴，知。］
(1)嘲笑；讥笑。
(2)歌唱；吟咏。
(3)戏弄；挑逗。
[②]［zhāo］
(1)鸟鸣。
(2)方言。私下议论、传布。
(3)见“嘲2哳”。

嘲字的英文翻译

◎ 嘲
ridicule, deride

嘲字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　嘲； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页207第08
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?陟交切，音䞴。【說文】謔也。【玉篇】言相調也。【前漢·揚雄傳】執蝘蜓而嘲黽龍。　【說文】通作啁。【集韻】或作謿。

考證：〔【前漢·揚雄傳】執?蜓而嘲黽龍。〕　謹照原文?改蝘。
嘲字的源字形

嘲字的起名意思

意为取笑，讥笑。

cháo/zhão
嘲|嘲
隶
1nIRト 山: 相日
Пиктофонетические символы.
Рот выражает смысл, его образ подобен открытому рту, выражающему насмешку; Чао (чдо) выражает звук в сторону праведности взгляда, выражая насмешку над некоторыми людьми.
Первоначальный смысл - насмешка.
Очао смеялись друг над другом словами, высмеивали: ~ сарказм, холод ~ удовлетворение. Джао [насмешка] описал голос как сложный и подробный.
О ~ сарказм ~ посмеяться ~ расшифровать ~ холодно ~ доволен О ~ ясно
